vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
παιδᾰγωγ-ός, ὁ,
={παιδὸς ἀγωγός}, slave who went with a boy from home to school and back again, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; with διδάσκαλος, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of Phoenix, as the π. of Achilles, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; Fabius is called the π. of Hannibal, because he always followed him about, [Refs 1st c.AD+] has guided us until attainment of faith in Christ, [NT]: generally, leader, δημοκρατίας, τυραννίδος, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
guardian, custodian, supervisor tutor
a pedagogue, childtender, schoolmaster a person, usually a slave or freedman, to whom the care of the boys of a family was committed, whose duty it was to attend them at their play, lead them to and from the public school, and exercise a constant superintendence over their conduct and safety; in NT an ordinary director or minister, guardian contrasted with an Apostle, as a pedagogue occupies an inferior position to a parent, 1Cor. 4:15; a term applied to the Mosaic law, as dealing with men as in a state of mere childhood and tutelage, Gal. 3:24, 25*
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition: 指導者,領袖,守護者 (林前 4:15; 加 3:24,25)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition: 指导者,领袖,守护者 (林前 4:15; 加 3:24,25)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: kẻ hướng dẫn; người giám hộ; thầy giáo. παῖς (G3816) + ἄγω (G71)
